## 889. THIN
### Definition
Most generic word describing a relatively small width between opposite surfaces or sides of an object. See: https://github.com/lingdb/CoBL-public/wiki/thinMany languages distinguish between 1D (rope) and 2D (wall) thickness. The main term should be the 2D one. The 1D term can be entered as a synonym.

### Contexts
1. This stalk is thin, it is easy to break. 2. This wall is thick, that one is thin. 3. This rope is thick, that one is thin.
